alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 5:17PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Georgetown and south central Williamsburg Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms between 5 miles south of Trio across Andrews to Graves, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and a period of blinding heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary ponding across low lying arteas and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Yawkey South Island, Winyah Bay Entrance, Andrews, North Santee, Lambert, Sampit, Graves, Earle, Oatland and Georgetown Memorial Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
